title: Kirchhoff loop - 12 V and 8 V and 1-ohm x 4 and C

content.question: The <math alttext="R C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>RC</mi></math> circuit shown in the figure has been connected for a long time and currents have reached steady-state values. What is the potential difference across the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
